duties_responsibilities.duty: Direct, and coordinate activities concerned with production of company product(s).
Plan and direct production activities and establish production priorities for products in keeping with effective operations and cost factors.
Interact with State, County, and independent inspection personnel.
Maintain clear and precise records according to internal program.
Pre-pour and post-pour inspection of precast concrete products to assure products conform to specifications.
Testing of concrete to assure concrete meets project specifications.
Perform moisture test and sieve analysis.
Spread test / Slump.
Coordinate production activities with procurement, maintenance, and quality control activities to obtain optimum production and utilization of human resources, machines, and equipment.
Reviews and analyzes production, quality control, maintenance, and operational reports to determine causes of nonconformity with product specifications, and operation or production problems.
Compile, store, and retrieve equipment checklist.
Innovation, testing, and development of new products.
On-going teaching, training, and development of personnel.
Conduct safety and production meetings.
Order sufficient raw materials to meet anticipated demands.
Maintain property inventory control procedures over materials to minimize shrinkage and waste.
Inform owner on a timely basis of any plant activity, issues, or concerns that might impact customer service.
Communicate daily with corporate office and personnel in a polite and cordial manner.
Set and keep the pace for timeliness of work being done.

Confer with management personnel to establish production and quality control standards, manage budget and cost controls, and to obtain data regarding types, quantities, specifications, and delivery dates of products ordered.
Maintain a clean and safe work area.
Other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) is required.
Must be able to create and understand shop drawings.
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field (Master's preferred)
